intro: Ribes contumazensis, commonly known as the Peruvian gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruits, which are edible, develop into small, tart berries resembling those of the gooseberry. Ribes contumazensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
